intro: Dircaea reflexa, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are yellow and occur in a single, erect stem, blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
